episodes.title: The Dark Secret at the Heart of the Jehovah’s Witnesses | Informer
episodes.description:
The Jehovah’s Witnesses are an end of days Christian organisation who are known for knocking on doors and rejecting blood transfusions. However, they have also been subject to increasing scrutiny over their handling of child sex abuse cases within their congregations, and their treatment of victims. In this episode of Informer, we speak to a former Jehovah’s Witness elder who was abused as a child but didn’t report what had happened. As an adult, he felt a painful déjà vu when his own daughter told him she had also been abused. 

Watch more from this series here: 

The Worst Things I've Experienced Working in Care
https://youtu.be/Y2C3_EZK12U

How I Escaped the Church of Scientology 
https://youtu.be/pjzj2aUPr2g

How a Sex Party Actually Works
https://youtu.be/A0PDEN7iDdo

episodes.title: How I Escaped the Church of Scientology
episodes.description:
The Church of Scientology is well known for its celebrity following and the intergalactic warrior lord Xenu – who you can only learn about after climbing a paywall of courses worth many thousands of dollars. But who you don’t often hear from are the employees of the Church, who can be forced to work incredibly long hours for a tiny wage. 

In this episode of Informer, we speak to a former employee of the Church of Scientology, who was pressured into signing a work contract, had his passport taken off him, and regularly worked 80 hour weeks to earn under £5,000 a year. 

Watch more like this: 

How a Sex Party Actually Works
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A0PDEN7iDdo&t=198s

I Clean Up After Murders, Meth Labs & Serial Killers
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x5XjEH5ukp0&t=1s

How I Stole $300 Million in Rare Diamonds
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=85EROW8QBh8

episodes.title: Ex-Cult Member Explains How He Escaped the Moonies
episodes.description:
When Steven Hassan was 19 years old, he was recruited by the Unification Church, an infamous cult know for its mass marriage ceremonies. He spent two and a half years with the group, working to bring in new members, raise money, and preach the teachings of its controversial founder, Sun Myung Moon—until a near-fatal car accident helped him realize he’d been brainwashed, and led him to flee the cult. After the World Peace and Unification Sanctuary—an offshoot of the Unification Church—nabbed international headlines for holding a blessing ceremony complete with AR-15s and bullet crowns earlier this year, we met up with Hassan to hear more about his time as a “Moonie,” find out how he escaped, and learn why he’s since dedicated his life to becoming an expert on cults.

WATCH NEXT: Inside the Church of the AR-15 -- https://youtu.be/ArfGyo6HQ_E
